intro: Erigeron nivalis, commonly known as the snowblue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. It produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. Erigeron nivalis is often found in meadows and rocky slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of high-altitude ecosystems.
